message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CR, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.DB

The paper deals with the problem of detecting fake reviews in user review social networks, which is a topic that falls under the categories of social networks, information retrieval, and databases. The paper proposes a new type of attack called elite Sybil attacks, which recruit highly-rated accounts to generate realistic-looking reviews. This type of attack is likely to fall under the categories of security and privacy (cs.CR), social and information networks (cs.SI), and social computing (cs.SOC). The paper also proposes a detection scheme that involves analyzing large amounts of data, which is likely to fall under the categories of information retrieval (cs.IR) and databases (cs.DB).
